Minute Entry for proceedings held before US Magistrate Judge Marcos E. Lopez: Arraignment/Detention as to Mirna Liz Torres-Perez (11) Counts 1,2,3,4,5 held on 2/24/2015. Present AUSA Jose Contreras, Atty. Yassmin Gonzalez and PO Linda Perez. Defendant waived the reading of the Indictment and entered a plea of not guilty as to all counts. The Government has 7 days to produce discovery and the defense has 14 days thereafter to file motions. Case is referred to Chief Judge Delgado for further proceedings. As to detention, defense counsel argued in favor of bail. The government requested detention. The Court ordered defendant detained only on the basis of danger to the community. (Court Reporter FTR.)Hearing set for 01:30.Hearing held at 01:55.Hearing ended at 02:11.Interpreter Felix Toledo. (ft) (Entered: 03/03/2015)

Minute Entry for proceedings held before US Magistrate Judge Marcos E. Lopez: Arraignment/Detention as to Billy Rosario-Maldonado (18) Counts 1,2,3,4,5 held on 2/24/2015. Present AUSA Jose Contreras, Atty. Ludwig Ortiz and PO Linda Perez. Defendant waived the reading of the Indictment and entered a plea of not guilty as to all counts. The Government has 7 days to produce discovery and the defense has 14 days thereafter to file motions. Case is referred to Chief Judge Delgado for further proceedings. As to detention, defense counsel argued in favor of bail. The Court imposed bail in the amount of $5,000.00 of which $1,000.00 will be cash or secured and $4,000.00 unsecured, drug testing and treatment, education, if defendant is not enrolled in full time education, then defendant has to work, home detention with EMD, to the extent that defendant is financially able to pay the costs of the EMD, he will be responsible to pay the EMD, defendant is not allowed to drive, defendant is not allowed to enter or reside in the Villa Evangelina PHP, defendant's mother Janet Maldonado has to co-sign for bail purposes, plus all other standard conditions of release. (Court Reporter FTR.)Hearing set for 01:30.Hearing held at 01:37.Hearing ended at 01:54. Interpreter Felix Toledo. (ft) (Entered: 03/04/2015)

Minute Entry for proceedings held before US Magistrate Judge Marcos E. Lopez: Arraignment/Detention as to John Felix Gonzalez-Perez (23) Counts 1,2,3,4,5 held on 2/24/2015. Present AUSA Jose Contreras, Atty. Raymond Rivera and PO Linda Perez. Defendant waived the reading of the Indictment and entered a plea of not guilty as to all counts. The Government has 7 days to produce discovery and the defense has 14 days thereafter to file motions. Case is referred to Chief Judge Delgado for further proceedings. As to detention, defense counsel argued in favor of bail. The government requested detention. The Court imposed bail in the amount of $5,000.00 of which $2,000.00 will be cash or secured and $3,000.00 unsecured, drug testing and treatment, employment, defendant is not allowed to enter or reside at anytime the Villa Evangelina PHP, to the extent that the USPO deemed it necessary mental health evaluation and if necessary treatment, plus all other standard conditions of release. (Court Reporter FTR.)Hearing set for 01:30.Hearing held at 02:11.Hearing ended at 02:22 Interpreter Felix Toledo. (ft) (Entered: 03/04/2015)

Minute Entry for proceedings held before US Magistrate Judge Marcos E. Lopez: Arraignment/Detention as to Francisco Martinez-Moreno (7) Counts 1,2,3,4,5 held on 2/24/2015. Present AUSA Jose Contreras, Atty. Enrique Velez and PO Linda Perez. Defendant waived the reading of the Indictment and entered a plea of not guilty as to all counts. The Government has 7 days to produce discovery and the defense has 14 days thereafter to file motions. Case is referred to Chief Judge Delgado for further proceedings. As to detention, defense counsel will abide by the pretrial report that is recommending bail and requested an in-patient out-patient program. The government requested detention. The Court ordered defendant detained only on the basis of danger to the community. Defense counsel reserved the right to request a reopening of the bail hearing. Also, counsel informed the court of defendant's medical conditions. The Court ordered a second notice be sent to MDC. (Court Reporter FTR.)Hearing set for
30.Hearing held at 02:22.Hearing ended at 03:02.Interpreter Felix Toledo. (ft) (Entered: 03/04/2015)

Minute Entry for proceedings held before US Magistrate Judge Marcos E. Lopez: Arraignment/Detention as to Jose M. Pizzaro-Mezquita (9) Counts 1,2,3,4,5 held on 2/25/2015. Present SAUSA Kelly Zenon, Atty. David Ramos and PO Patricia Cordova. Defendant waived the reading of the Indictment and entered a plea of not guilty as to all counts. The Government has 7 days to produce discovery and the defense has 14 days thereafter to file motions. Case is referred to Chief Judge Delgado for further proceedings. As to detention, defense counsel argued in favor of bail. The government requested detention. Minute Entry for proceedings held before US Magistrate Judge Silvia Carreno-Coll: Arraignment/Bail Hearings as to Miguel Torres-Cruz (4) Count 1,2,3,4,5 held on

12/2015. AUSA Edward Veronda and defense counsel Lara H. Castro were present. As to Arraignment, the Court finds defendant competent at this time. Defendant waived the reading of the Indictment. Plea of Not Guilty is entered. During the colloquy, the Court asked defendant if he understood what he was being charged and the maximum penalties, for defendant answered in the affirmative. Defense is granted seven (7) days to obtain discovery and fourteen (14) days thereafter to file all motions. The case is referred to the Judge for trial setting thereafter. As to Bail, the Government proffered defendant's role and/or participation, that defendant is detained in another case and is awaiting sentence and moved for detention. Defense counsel proffered that defendant be placed on a recommended bond in the pretrial report from the other case, that parents may serve as third party custodians, that their property may be posted as collateral for bail and that home detention may be placed as a condition. After listening to the parties, the Court took the matter under advisement pending the review of the pretrial report of that other criminal case before Judge Fuste. (Court Reporter FTR/bg.) Minute Entry for proceedings held before US Magistrate Judge Silvia Carreno-Coll: Arraignment/Bail Hearings as to Kelvin Candelaria-Ortiz (22) Count 1,2,3,4,5 held on 4/9/2015. SAUSA Glenn Goetchius and defense counsel Juan Masini were present. As to Arraignment, the Court finds defendant competent at this time. Defendant waived the reading of the Indictment. Plea of Not Guilty is entered. During the colloquy, the Court asked defendant if he understood what he was being charged and the maximum penalties, for defendant answered in the affirmative. Defense is granted seven (7) days to obtain discovery and fourteen (14) days thereafter to file all motions. The case is referred to the Judge for trial setting thereafter. As to Bail, defense counsel disagreed with the pretrial recommendation. Defendant may stay in two places and believes that release conditions may be imposed. The Government proffered that defendant was on bail when convicted in a separate conduct, the probation officer in the State of PA recommended no bail and moved for detention. Arguments were heard by the parties. After listening to the parties and being a presumption case, the Court ordered defendant detained without bail pending trial. However, if after recetving and reviewing discovery, counsel may reopen the matter of bail. (Court Reporter FTR/bg.) Hearing set for 09:15. Hearing held at 10:07. Hearing ended at 10:24. Interpreter Sonia Crescioni. (br) (Entered: 04/14/2015)

Minute Entry for proceedings held before Chief Judge Aida M. Delgado-Colon: Pretrial Conference as to John Felix Gonzalez-Perez (23) held on 10/15/2015. Present: AUSAs Edward Veronda and John Andre Matthews, I and defense counsel Raymond Rivera. Government informs that on 10/8/15, along with defense counsel and client, he gave a proffer of the evidence, including the physical evidence that will be presented at trial. A final plea offer deadline was also extended. Jencks, Giglio and Brady Material will be disclosed tomorrow at 9:00 AM. Government does not anticipate any discovery issues, except for the matter of the items seized at the apartment (2 drug ledgers, gun slide, and radio scanners). Expects 3-4 days to present case in chief, will present 10-13 witnesses, 5-6 videos (with no objection by defense, non-certified translations were provided) and certified translations of the ledger will be provided shortly. Requests the plea supplement of one of the co-defendants that will plead guilty on Monday and testifying at trial be provided to him, so it can be disclosed to the defense. As to the seized items, defense will discuss this matter with Government's counsel, because his client did not live at the apartment. Defense informs his client will exercise his right to go to trial. Requests an extension until 10/19/15 to file proposed voir dire/jury instructions. Court grants the extension to the defense. Requested plea supplement to be provided to Government's counsel. Defense counsel will have it in his possession solely for trial purposes, must be safely kept by counsel and properly disposed of upon conclusion of trial. Any other discovery matters must be brought forth by the parties before trial date. Minute Entry for proceedings held before Judge Jose A. Fuste in Cr. Cases 15-124-007 (JAF) and 15-162-014 (JAF): Sentencing held on 1/11/2016 for Francisco Martinez- Moreno (7). Present: AUSA Edward Veronda, Atty. Enrique Velez, USPO Merangelie Serrano. Defendant is U/C, present in court and is being assisted by the Court Interpreter. No objections to the PSI Report. The Court reviewed defendant's medical records from BOP. Order to MDC to be entered re defendant's medical treatment. Allocution heard. IMPR for 70 months as to Ct. 1 in Cr. Case 15-124 and 60 months as to Ct. 6 in Cr. Case 15-162 to be served consecutively to each other for a total IMPR term of 130 months; SRT of 6 years as to Ct. 1 in Cr. Case 15-124 and 5 years as to Ct. 6 in Cr. Case 15-162 to be served concurrently to each other; SMA of $200.00; Remaining counts are dismissed. (Court Reporter Amy Walker.)Hearing set for 09:30.Hearing held at 09:46.Hearing ended at 10:21.Interpreter Annie Flores. (dv) (Entered: 01/11/2016)

Minute Entry for proceedings held before Chief Judge Aida M. Delgado-Colon: Sentencing held on 4/11/2016 for Christian Mercado-Figueroa (8). Present: AUSA Edward Veronda and defense counsel Lydia Lizarribar. Defendant is under custody and assisted by the Court Interpreter. USPO Milva Razetto also present. Sentencing Memorandum filed by the defense at DE 708 is Noted. PSR to be amended accordingly to the changes ordered by the Court. Defendant's allocution heard. Count(s) 1 & 6. IMPR: Sixty (60) months as to Count One (1) and sixty months as to Count Six (6), to be served consecutively to each other, for a total term of 120 months. SRT of eight (8) years as to Count One (1) and five (5) years as to Count Six (6), to be served concurrently with each other. No fine. SMA of $100.00 per count.; Count(s) 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, Dismissed. It's noted that paragraph #19 of the plea agreement is not applicable to the defendant, he is not indicted in CR. 15-0162(JAF), this was an error, as clarified as clarified at sentencing hearing. Minute Entry for proceedings held before US Magistrate Judge Silvia Carreno-Coll: Arraignment/Bail as to Luis E. Rivera-Pares (6) Count 1,2,3,4,5,6 held on 11/21/2016. Present were AUSA Edward Veronda, defense counsel Irma Valldejuli and USPO Manuel Roman. The defendant was under custody, present in court and assisted by the Court Interpreter. The defendant was found competent to understand the proceedings. He waived the reading of the Indictment and entered a plea of not guilty as to all counts of the Indictment. The Government has 7 days to produce discovery and the defense has 14 days thereafter to file motions. Case is referred to Chief U.S. District Judge, Aida M.  Delgado Colon for further proceedings. As to bail, the Government moved for detention. Defense counsel argued in favor of bail. After hearing the parties, the Court ordered defendant detained pending further proceedings. Order to issue. (Court Reporter DCR.) Hearing set for 2:00 pm. Hearing held at 2:44 pm. Hearing ended at 2:50 pm. Interpreter Felix Toledo. (cmd) (Entered: 11/21/2016)

Minute Entry for proceedings held before US Magistrate Judge Camille L. Velez- Rive:Bond Revocation Hearing as to David Otero-Lugo (15) held on 1/30/2019. Present were AUSA Ginette Milanes, Mr. Raul Mariani, and USPO Damary Flores. Defendant was present and under custody. Mr. Mariani stated for the record that defendant did not contest the allegations contained in the motion filed by Probation as to absconding from the jurisdiction. They also requested that defendant not be removed from this jurisdiction by the USM until he has been interviewed by Probation for the preparation of the presentence report. The Court granted the request of defendant not being removed from the jurisdiction, and also revoked defendant's bail. He will remain detained pending sentencing by Judge Delgado-Colon. (Court Reporter -DCR.)Hearing set for 09:00.Hearing held at 09:44.Hearing ended at 09:46.Interpreter -Felix Toledo. (yr) (Entered: 01/30/2019)

Minute Entry for proceedings held before Judge Aida M. Delgado-Colon: Sentencing held on 3/11/2020 for David Otero-Lugo (15). Present: AUSA Mare Chattah and defense counsel Raul Mariani. Defendant present, under custody and assisted by the Court Interpreter. USPO Francisco Llovet also present. Statements in support of mitigation of punishment heard on behalf of the defense. Defendant's allocution heard. Government requested a sentence of 60 months. Sidebar Conference held with US Probation. Court did not allocate the 2 points for obstruction of justice (defendant absconded while on pretrial release and arrest warrant was issued). Pre-Sentence Report to be amended accordingly. Count(s) 1, IMPR: Sixty (60) months. SRT of eight (8) years. No fine. SMA of $100.00.; Count(s) 2, 3, 4, 5, Dismissed. The Motion for Return of Surety at 918 is Granted. (Court Reporter Zulma Ruiz.) Hearing set for 1:30 p.m. Hearing held at 1:50 p.m. Hearing ended at 2:25 p.m. Interpreter Annie Flores. (sr) (Entered: 03/11/2020)

JUDGMENT as to David Otero-Lugo (15), Count(s) 1, IMPR: Sixty (60) months. SRT of eight (8) years. No fine. SMA of $100.00.; Count(s) 2, 3, 4, 5, Dismissed. Signed by Judge Aida M. Delgado-Colon on 3/11/2020.(sr) (Entered: 03/11/2020)

Minute Entry for proceedings held before US Magistrate Judge Marshal D. Morgan:Show Cause Hearing as to Kelvin Candelaria-Ortiz (22) held on 12/4/2020. Present: AUSA Linet Suarez, FAFPD Hector Ramos and USPO Linda Perez. The defendant was present, under conditions of supervised release and assisted by a certified court interpreter. All parties were present via VTC. The Court found that the defendant knowingly and voluntarily waived his right to attend this hearing in person and consented to proceed by way of VTC. The defendant was advised of the SRT violations alleged in the Motion filed by USPO Perez at Docket No. 956 . The defendant was also advised of his rights. In Order issued at Docket No. 962, the Federal Public Defender was appointed to represent the defendant. The case was referred to U.S. District Judge Aida M. Delgado-Colon for Final Revocation Hearing. The defendant shall remain under the same conditions of supervised release pending further proceedings. Pursuant to the Due Process Protections Act, the Court confirmed the United States' obligation to produce all exculpatory evidence to the defendant pursuant to Brady v. Maryland, 373 U.S. 83 (1963) and its progeny, and ordered it to do so. Failing to do so in a timely manner may result in consequences, including, but not limited to, exclusion of evidence, adverse jury instructions, dismissal of charges, contempt proceedings or sanctions by the Court. Final Hearing re Revocation of Supervised Release to be set by the Presiding Judge. (Court Reporter Evilys Carrion.)Hearing set for 10:30.Hearing held at 10:26.Hearing ended at 10:31.Interpreter Felix Toledo. (lod) (Entered: 12/10/2020)

Minute Entry for proceedings held before Judge Aida M. Delgado-Colon: Sentence as to Victor Manuel Ortiz-Salgado (17) not held on 2/9/2021 by VTC. Present: AUSA Marie Christine Amy and defense counsel Luz Rios. Defendant on bond and assisted by the Court Interpreter. USPO Alexandra Estrada also present. The findings under the CARES Act should reflect that given the exigent circumstances created by the COVID pandemic and the Declaration of Emergency by the State and Federal Government, this hearing is being conducted by VTC in order to ensure the rights of the defendant, his eligibility for programs subsequent to sentencing, which will turn to his benefit, and the health of all the parties involved. Defense stated she had no objections to the Pre-Sentence Report. Pending matters regarding sentencing brought forth in motion filed at 981 were addressed. After hearing the parties, the Court found that additional information is needed in order to proceed. Therefore, Government is to file and submit the requested documents for the Court's review. Sentencing Hearing is reset for 2/24/2021 at 3:00 PM in VTC Bridge ADC before Judge Aida M. Delgado-Colon. (Court Reporter Amy Walker.) Minute Entry for proceedings held before Judge Aida M. Delgado-Colon: Sentencing held on 2/24/2021 for Victor Manuel Ortiz-Salgado (17) by VTC. Present: AUSA Marie Christine Amy and defense counsel Luz Rios. Defendant present, on bond and assisted by the Court Interpreter. USPO Alexandra Estrada also present. The findings under the CARES Act should reflect that given the exigent circumstances created by the COVID pandemic and the Declaration of Emergency by the State and Federal Government, this hearing is being conducted by VTC in order to ensure the rights of the defendant, his eligibility for programs subsequent to sentencing, which will turn to his benefit, and the health of all the parties involved. Government informed that the previous concerns were addressed and clarified that parties have agreed to amend the plea agreement. The amended plea agreement eliminates the mention of USC 860 as part of the offenses for which the defendant entered a plea of guilty. Defense counsel was in agreement with the new terms of the plea agreement and defendant was also so advised and they have no objections. Therefore, the Court adopted the amended plea agreement of the parties. The  USPO is to amend the Pre-Sentence Report accordingly. Defendant's allocution heard. Count(s) 1, IMPR: 37 months. SRT of 8 years. No fine. SMA of $100.00.; Count(s) 2, 3, 4,5, Dismissed. Defendant is to voluntary surrender to the designated facility, once notified by the US Marshals. Defendant assisted by counsel, asserted he will not appeal the sentence imposed by the Court. (Court Reporter Amy Walker.) Hearing set for 3:00 p.m. Hearing held at 2:45 p.m. Hearing ended at 3:10 p.m. Interpreter Sonia Crescioni. (sr) (Entered: 02/24/2021)

JUDGMENT as to Victor Manuel Ortiz-Salgado (17), Count(s) 1, IMPR: 37 months. SRT of 8 years. No fine. SMA of $100.00.; Count(s) 2, 3, 4, 5, Dismissed. Signed by Judge Aida M. Delgado-Colon on 2/24/2021 .(sr) (Entered: 02/24/2021)
